docs.lead_paragraph: IT is a rare thing, in this country, to find anything of interest in court decisions apart from the exposition of legal opinions. Few judges have excelled in literary ability to such an extent that their writings are read for any reason other than their interpretation of the law.

headline.main: A JUDGE WHO SCANS THE DRAMA OF LIFE; Woolsey of the Federal Bench Gives Not Only Judicial Opinions, but Observations on the Human Comedy
